bibl.title: William Fox vs. Washington Territory Writ of Habeaus Corpuss
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: Territory of Washington County of King } SS
H.S. Thornton Constable L.V. Wyckoff Sheriff and Keeper of the jail of said King County W.J.

Whereas at a Justice Court held at my office in said County for the brief of William S. Wiggin for the office of having fraudulently converted to his own large shame of money left on deposit in the safe of the "Occidental Hotel" during the last months past and under the 09th day of April A.D. 1978, in said county and upon said trial the said Court did adjudge and deliver mine that the complaint in the case was and is without probable cause that there was no reasonable grounds therfore that the costs herein he against William Fox, the complamant herein, and that the said William S. Wiggins, the defendant hererin do here and weaven the judgment against him the said William Fox the said costs A.D. 92/ Whereupon the said William Fox

hereby personally present is now here sentenced to pay the said costs layed at $92.75 and stand committed now be the same be paid and whereas, the said William Fox has made default in the payment of the same.

Therefore, you, the said H.S. Thornston Constable, are hereby commanded in the name of the United States forthwith to convey and deliver the said William Fox to the said Keeper and upon the said Keeper, are hereby commanded to recieve the said William Fox into your custody in said jail, and him there safely keep as hard labor for the space of (41) forty-one days, unless said cash he paid or he there be discharged by due cause of law.
Albert M. Snyder Justice of the Peace, Seattle Precent King Co. to W.S.
I hereby certify that I witness
The matter named William Fox in to the custody of L. V. Wyckoff Sheriff of King County and Judge of said county. Settled at Seattle on 1st day of June 1878
H. S. Thornton Constantable Seattle Present King County
L. V. Wyckoff Sheriff of King County do hereby certify that the above and foregoing is a true and and clear copy of me original commitment
Seattle June 14 1878 L. V. Wyckoff Sheriff
Washington Territory vs. William S. Wiggin
Justice of the peace $14.35 7.40 Lyts 21.55 Justices 37.80 Warrant and keeping 12.10 sum $93.90 P. Commitment filed $102
